passages.text: Australia | Metals & Mining Nickel Industries
1H25 - RKAB Quota CliffOr Lift

The balance sheet remains the focus. RKAB approval is critical as the 2025 9 Mt sales cap approaches by early- Oct- 25 which could pause sales until 2026. The planned Q4- 25 to Q1- 26 refi should extend tenor and reduce funding cost ahead of the US\\$253m ENC payments due Jan & Apr 2026. While we like NIC's diversified production growth and ability to maintain EBITDA margins in a cyclically low nickel market, current valuations are full, in our view. Reiterate HOLD. PT AUD0.70.

H1 CY25 Results - EBITDA lower, tax miss. Operational divisional EBITDA was pre- guided here, HY- 25 EBITDA was lower from corporate based costs. Tax was a material \(\) 22\(m higher, partially offset by\) \ \(11\) m lower D&A, accounting for a \(\sim 78\%\) miss at NPAT/EPS to our forecast. OpCF of \(\) 60\(m implies a low cash conversion relative to EBITDA given working capital and the DSRA build. No interim dividend was declared (pcp 2.5cps), and the FY24 final was paid with a DRP at\) \ \(0.75\) , issuing 50.1m shares. We expect limited dividends or buybacks for 2025/2026.

Balance sheet and liquidity reliant on refi, and \(\) 100m\(We line. Closing cash of\) \ \(145\) m was pre- released, net debt closed at \(\) 883m\(and H1 gearing of 0.35x, with a meaningful mix of secured bank debt and the 11.25% senior notes. NIC expects to refi in Q4 - 25 or Q1 - 26 to extend tenor, lower cost and smooth the 11% senior bond amortisation schedule beginning Oct - 25 / BNI DBS 2029 facility amortisation from Nov - 25. NIC remains in compliance with covenants: Net Debt / EBITDA \(\leq 2.5x\) ( \(\sim 2.77x\) ); DSCR \(\geq 1.3x\) , Debt to Equity \(\leq 1.5x\) ( \(\sim 0.41x\) ) and an Angel Nickel security coverage \(\geq 1.75x\) , however requires RKAB licence approvals, and ENC cash generation in early 2026, and refi.

NIC disclosed a signed commitment letter with two institutions for \(\) 100m\(working capital facility expected in the coming weeks, and expects the\) \ \(153m\) VAT recovery ( \(\sim\) 370m over the next 6- 12 months). While we continue to expect remaining ENC payments in US\\$126.5m in Jan- 26 & Apr- 26 respectively, we note Shanghai Decent remains supportive should timing flexibility be needed. We currently forecast internally- generated CFs, \(\) 100m\(working capital facility, and receipt of VAT as sufficient to facilitate the next leg of growth. However, we note that continued low NPI prices and elevated costs continue to compress EBITDA margins, requiring NIC to balance capital deployment in the near- term. We also see potential for the payment timeline to be further delayed should the company be unable to meet its commitments.

RKAB Licence Approval Ongoing. Hengjaya has sold 7.3 Mt by the end of Jul- 25 ( \(\sim 850\) kt limonite per qonth to PT Longsen); the current sales quota is being permitted to increase to 19 Mtpa from 9 Mtpa. The environmental study (AMDAL) was submitted in early- August, however we now see risk that sales will cease by late- Sep / early- Oct if approvals are not received as the quota reaches the 9Mt cap. Sampala continues approvals for a 6 Mtpa licence by year- end, but road development progressed.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 6 - 11 of this report. \\* Jefferies (Australia) Pty Ltd

Earnings Changes. We have updated our estimates to account for H1 2025 results. We have also revised our D&A estimates, net interest, and corporate costs.
Figure 1 - NIC Price and Nickel Price
Source: Company Reports, FactSet, Jefferies
Figure 2 - NIC Comparative Half Year Results
Source: Company Reports, FactSet, Visible Alpha, Jefferies
Figure 3 - NIC Forecast Changes

We are attracted to Nickel Industries' diversified nickel production growth, and ability to maintain positive EBITDA margins despite a cyclically weak nickel market. We view Nickel Industries as well- positioned to continue capital management initiatives through dividends, buybacks, and internally- funded organic and inorganic growth.

However, the expansion of low- cost nickel production in Indonesia has displaced higher- cost Western Supply, significantly diminishing industry cost support, which has in turn compressed production margins. Given these dynamics, we consider current valuations to be fair.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Our base- case PT is based on a blend of DCF \((50\%)\) , EV/EBITDA \((25\%)\) , and P/CF \((25\%)\) multiples. Our valuation assumes an \(80\%\) ownership of the mine and RKEF assets, completion of the \(55\%\) ownership of ENC, and \(10\%\) of HNC. We include \(\) 200m\(/\) \ \(0.05\) as for future projects and exploration (Sampala) in our valuation. We continue to see the Hengjaya Mine being progressively divested to the required \(49\%\) by 2028.
Our upside scenario PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples, utilises our base- case assumptions but assumes a \(15\%\) higher commodity price deck.
Our downside scenario PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples, utilises our base- case assumptions but assumes a \(15\%\) lower commodity price deck.

Top Material Issue(s): Key issues for the sector include the consideration of traditional owners of the land on which mines are located, net- zero targets and actions being taken to achieve set goals, and workforce safety and structure, for example, local community hired vs Fly- in, Fly- out workers.

Company Target(s): 1) targets for reducing its greenhouse gas emissions. 2) Sustainability targets have not been set by the company. 3) Zero fatality, zero loss time injuries, and zero corruption cases for the company.

Qs to Mgmt? What are your scope one, two, and three emissions? 2) Where are the tailings stored at IWIP and MIP? Do your tailings dams adhere to Global Standards? Are any of your waste facilities AMD (Acid Mine Drainage) forming? 3) Does your company comply with the global anti- money laundering requirements?
Sector Deep Dive: Mining

Source: Company Reports, Jefferies

Nickel IndustriesNickel Industries Limited produces nickel pig iron used in the production of stainless steel. In 2022 the company also commenced the production of nickel in high grade (HG) nickel matte, for use in the electric vehicle supply chain. It holds an \(80\%\) interest in the Hengjaya Mineralindo Nickel Mine, a large tonnage, high grade saprolite deposit that covers an area of 6,249 hectares located in the Morowali Regency of Central Sulawesi, Indonesia. The group's principal operations, located in Indonesia, are the Hengjaya Nickel, Oracle Nickel and Ranger Nickel rotary kiln electric furnace (RKEF) projects located within the Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP), the Angel Nickel RKEF Project at the Indonesia Weda Bay Industrial Park (IWIP) and the Hengjaya Mine, a large tonnage, high grade nickel laterite deposit in close proximity to the IMIP. The company holds an \(80\%\) interest in each of the Angel Nickel, Hengjaya Nickel and Ranger Nickel projects and the Hengjaya Mine and a \(70\%\) interest in the Oracle Nickel project. The company was incorporated in 2007 and is based in Sydney, Australia.

Our PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA and P/CF multiples. Risks: impact of Covid 19; fluctuations in commodity prices, Australian dollar and Rupiah; estimates of mineral resources and ore reserves are subject to error; reserves depleted by production must be continually replaced; mining and insurance risks; environmental, health, safety and permits; climate change; community relations.
(Article 3(1)e) and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
